DOC.brief_summary: The physiological changes and postoperative pain are directly related with the degree of intra-abdominal pressure kept during the laparoscopy. The present study aims to examine difference between low pressure pneumoperitoneum (8 mm Hg)and High pressure pneumoperitoneum (12 mm Hg)during laparoscopic cholecystectomy in terms of pain, cardio-pulmonary function, arterial blood gas changes etc.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between Low Pressure Versus High Pressure Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
DOC.criteria: symptomatic gall stone disease pyocele gangrene of gall bladder history of cholangitis simultaneous CBD stones gall stone pancreatitis who does not give consent if they will be randomized to LPLC
